imt: one {of:the} politicians feel.{\thirdperson}{\sg} that soon {break:out}.{\thirdperson}{\sg} huge scandal on arena.{\LOC} international

imt: company deny.{\lptcp}.{\sg}.{\fem} jakoby / {as if} / {as if} be.{\lptcp}.{\nvir}.{\pl} reports about faulty cards.{\LOC}

trs: Intended meaning: `The company denied that there were supposedly any reports about faulty prepaid cards.

trs: Intended meaning: `The claim that  sunglasses supposedly restrict visibility is absurd.

imt: seem.{\thirdperson}{\sg} me.{\dat} {\refl} jakoby Hobbit think.{\lptcp}.{\sg}.{\masc} differently
src: Zdaje mi się, \textbf{jakoby} Hobbit uważał inaczej.
trs: It seems to me as if Hobbit would think differently.' \nquelle{NKJP, an internet forum, 19/8/1999}

imt: seem.{\thirdperson}{\sg} me.{\dat} {\refl} jakoby.{\firstperson}{\sg} hear.{\lptcp}.{\sg}.{\masc} some crying.{\acc}
src: Zdaje mi się, \textbf{jakobym} słyszał jakieś wołanie.
trs: It seems to me as if I heard someone crying.' \quelle{\citealt[105]{ojasiewicz1992}}

imt: order.{\lptcp}.{\sg}.{\masc} beer but \emph{chyba} him.{\dat} {\negation} {be:tasty}.{\thirdperson}{\sg} because barely soak.{\lptcp}.{\sg}.{\masc} lips
src: Zamówił piwo. Ale \textbf{chyba} mu nie smakuje, bo ledwie umoczył usta.
trs: He ordered a beer. But he probably doesn't like it because he barely soaked his lips in it.' \quelle{FP, p. 44}

imt: Adam claim.{\thirdperson}{\sg} that beer him.{\dat} \emph{chyba} {\negation} {be:tasty}.{\thirdperson}{\sg}
src: Adam twierdzi, że piwo mu \textbf{chyba} nie smakuje.

src: Dorota powiedziała, \textbf{jakoby} Jan \textbf{musi} być chory.
trs: a) deontic: `Dorota said that supposedly Jan has to be sick.'\\

imt: Dorota say.{\lptcp}.{\sg}.{\fem} jakoby Jan can.{\thirdperson}{\sg} be.{\infv} sick
src: Dorota powiedziała, \textbf{jakoby} Jan \textbf{może} być chory.
trs: a) deontic: `Dorota said jakoby supposedly Jan is to be allowed to be sick.'\\

imt: that allegedly Jan be.{\lptcp}.{\sg}.{\masc} happy  claim.{\lptcp}.{\sg}.{\fem} Dorota
src: \textbf{Że} \textbf{jakoby} Jan był szczęśliwy, twierdziła Dorota.
trs: That supposedly Jan was happy, Dorota claimed.

imt: yesterday say.{\lptcp}.{\sg}-{\masc}-{\firstperson}{\sg} that allegedly go.{\firstperson}{\sg} today to cinema.{\gen}
src: Wczoraj powiedział-e-\textbf{m}, \textbf{że} \textbf{jakoby} pójdę dzisiaj do kina.
trs: Yesterday I said that  I will supposedly go to the cinema today.

imt: say.{\thirdperson}{\sg} {\refl} jakoby Jacek  {\passaux}.{\lptcp}.{\sg}.{\masc} elect.{\ptcp}.{\masc} on chief.{\acc} but I in this {\negation} believe.{\firstperson}{\sg}
src: Mówi się, \textbf{jakoby} Jacek został wybrany na naczelnika, ale ja w to nie wierzę.
trs: It is said that supposedly Jacek was elected chief, but I don't believe that.' \nquelle{\citealt[14]{JedrzejowskiSchenner-2013}}

imt: (s)he-{\pl}={\rep} I-{\illa}={\topi} money-{\acc} lot-{\incl}-{\LOC} leave-{\firstperson}{\object}-{\thirdperson} not-{\impr} right see-{\ptcp}-{\secondperson} not one Sol-{\acc} cent-{\acc}={\add} leave-{\prog}-{\firstperson}{\object}-{\thirdperson}={\negation}
src: Pay-kuna\textbf{=s} ñoqa-man=qa qulqi-ta muntu-ntin-pi saqiy-wa-n, mana-má riki riku-sqa-yki ni un sol-ta centavo-ta=pis saqi-sha-wa-n=chu.
trs: They left me a lot of money, (but) that's not true, as you have seen, they didn't leave me one sol, not one cent.'\quelle{\citealt[679, ex. 37]{Faller2011}}

imt: company claim.{\lptcp}.{\sg}.{\fem} jakoby {\negation} be.{\lptcp}.{\sg}.{\n} reports about faulty cards.{\LOC}
src: Firma twierdziła, \textbf{jakoby} \textbf{nie} było zgłoszeń o wadliwych kartach.
